column1: European Master in Archaeological Materials Science (ARCHMAT)
column5: WHAT?ARCHMAT is a 2-years European programme (120 ECTS) within a consortium of 3 degree-awarding Universities (University of Evora in Portugal, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki in Greece, and Sapienza University of Rome in Italy), 7 Partner Universities (Avignon in France, Palermo in Italy, Turin Polytechnic in Italy, Burgos in Spain, Gent in Belgium, Ben Gurion Negev in Israel, Al Farabi Kazakh Nat. University), many Museum and Research Centres (Human Evolution Museum, Burgos; Museo delle Civiltà, Rome; Centre for Archaeology, Lisbon; Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology, University of Sao Paulo, Brazil; Institute of Mater. Science of Aragon, Spain; Zaragoza - ICMA, Spain; Ormylia Art Diagnosis Center, Greece; Israel Museum Jerusalem; GuoWenYan Cult. Heritage Conserv. Center, China), 1 NGO (Fondazione Flaminia, Ravenna, Italy), 1 Civil Society Organization (WATCH, Rome), and 1 Association of SMEs in Archaeometry sector (Archeomed®, Arles, France) as associated partners.
